summary: The text discusses the National Vigilance Center (Operation) Regulations, 2065 published in Nepal Gazette. It outlines the use of authority by the Nepali government to combat corruption as per the Corruption Prevention Act, 2059. The regulations cover the establishment and operation of the National Vigilance Center, including information collection and management. It also details the process for reporting irregularities and receiving complaints through various mediums. The regulations aim to enhance transparency and accountability in government operations.

summary: The text discusses the National Vigilance Security Rules, 2071, with subsequent amendments. It outlines the establishment and operation of the National Vigilance Security Service, as per the provisions of the law. The rules define the roles and responsibilities of security personnel, including their ranks and categories. The document also specifies the formation of the Vigilance Security Service and the hierarchy of positions within the organization.

summary: The text discusses the National Assembly Regulations of Nepal, published in the Nepal Gazette in 2075. It includes amendments to the regulations in 2075, 2080, and addresses the functioning and structure of the National Assembly. The regulations define terms like "Chairperson" and "Vice-Chairperson" and outline the procedures for presenting proposals in the Assembly. The text also clarifies the roles of Ministers and other officials within the Assembly.

summary: The text discusses the National Assembly Member Election Act of 2075, which aims to establish legal provisions for the election of National Assembly members in Nepal. It outlines the definitions and procedures related to the election process, including the roles of various officials and the use of electronic voting systems. The Act emphasizes the importance of fair and transparent elections in accordance with the Constitution of Nepal.

summary: The text discusses the National Assembly Member Election Rules, 2076 published in the Nepal Gazette. It outlines the procedures for conducting elections and the roles of various election bodies. The rules specify the process for voter registration, candidate nomination, and election program scheduling. Additionally, it details the publication of voter lists, candidate registration, and the determination of election symbols. The rules also cover the preparation and publication of final voter lists, as well as the designation of polling dates and locations.
